title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Tomato?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a slice of tomato, plus carbs, fiber, protein, fat details on a per-slice basis and quick variations for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Tomato?
assumptions: Medium slice (~20 g) from a fresh, ripe beefsteak tomato; raw, no added seasonings or dressings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by tomato variety, ripeness, size of slice, and growing conditions. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A medium slice of tomato contains about 4 calories and provides a bit of fiber and vitamins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of tomato?
faqs.a: Approximately 4 calories for a medium 20 g slice.

faqs.q: Does a tomato slice have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, about 0.8 g carbs and 0.2 g fiber per slice.

faqs.q: Are tomatoes low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Very lowâ€”0 g fat and 0.2 g protein per medium slice.

faqs.q: How does slice size affect calories in a tomato?
faqs.a: Larger slices have more calories; a 30 g slice is about 6 kcal.

faqs.q: What nutrients besides calories are in a tomato slice?
faqs.a: Includes vitamins A and C, potassium, and minimal sodium (1 mg).
